Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2011 11:35PM Jenjen78 wrote: Thanks for sharing. If this turns out to be cancer, I would opt for being aggressive too. I have two kids and I owe it to them to fight whatever it is. I wish you the best and hope you are recovering well.

Posts.Content: Jenjen78 wrote: Hello, I am 33 years old and went in for a breast exam. The doctor was concerned that the breast was not asymetrical, inverted nipple and felt different. I went in for an ultrasound and mamogram and was told to have an MRI. The MRI showed a 2mm tumor and I now need to see a surgeon. A 2mm spot is much too small to be cancer, right? I have lots of breast cancer in my family and now I am worried. Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 2mm tumor Jenjen78 Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2011 06:29PM Jenjen78 wrote: Thank you so much for your response. We have a strong family history of breast cancer. Waiting is the hardest part!
